thread.title: Dana White Shuts Down Islam Makhachev's UFC Middleweight Ambitions
thread.title_full: Dana White Shuts Down Islam Makhachev's UFC Middleweight Ambitions

author: Shayan Malik
title: Dana White Shuts Down Islam Makhachev's UFC Middleweight Ambitions
text:
Summary
- Makhachev wants to move up to 185 and is eyeing a potential fight against Dricus du Plessis.
- Dana White doubts Makhachev's chances at middleweight, prefers him to move to welterweight.
- White is more open to a superfight between Alex Pereira and du Plessis at middleweight.
The UFC Lightweight Champion Islam Makhachev
has recently been discussing a move to middleweight, though many were expecting welterweight to be the next path in his career.
This caught many fans off-guard, as Makhachev currently fights 30 pounds below middleweight, and now the UFC President Dana White has commented on a potential weight change.
Related
Islam Makhachev: Age, Height, Wife, Record & More
Discover key details about UFC lightweight champion Islam Makhachev, including his age, height, wife, fight record, and more.
Islam Makhachev Believes He Can Take On Dricus du Plessis
The Lightweight Champion Wants To Move From 155 To 185
In an interview with Ushatayka, Makhachev discussed two major things, the first being who he wants as his next opponent, and the other having to do with a superfight against UFC Middleweight Champion Dricus du Plessis.
Islam believes that he has the size and the frame to move to middleweight without it being a problem, and specifically mentioned his height. He also stated that he has the keys to victory if he were to fight du Plessis.
DDP responded to this claim during an interview with MainEventTV, calling the fight an easy payday if it were to ever happen. He explained how although Makhachev is big for the lightweight division, he considers himself big for the middleweight division.
Related
How Islam Makhachev is On the Path to Becoming the Greatest UFC Fighter Ever
UFC Lightweight Champion Islam Makhachev has taken over the MMA world by storm, all while slowly moving up in the greatest fighter rankings.
Dana White Responds To Makhachev's Middleweight Aspirations
The UFC President Is Not A Fan Of Islam's Idea Of Fighting Two Weight Classes Up
UFC President Dana White commented on Makhachev potentially moving up to middleweight at the Power Slap 11 Press Conference, essentially stating that it won't happen. White is open to Islam moving up to welterweight, though the champion will not do so as he is good friends with the current UFC Welterweight Champion, Belal Muhammad.
When it came to a move regarding the 185 pound division, Dana explained how it was a different level, visibly expressing doubt about Islam's chances. He did not outright deny the idea, though it currently seems very unlikely.
There have been talks about a potential superfight between UFC Light Heavyweight Champion Alex Pereira coming back down to middleweight and challenging Dricus, and given the smaller weight difference, White was much more open to that idea.
Related
How Islam Makhachev Made Company History At UFC 311
At UFC 311, Islam Makhachev became the lightweight GOAT with most UFC Lightweight Championship wins and defenses.
